node.text:
• • • • •
We teased you yesterday, but no more monkeying around…here’s the recipe for Monkey Punch!

This tasty cocktail recipe has been created by Erik Lorincz from Kwānt, No.47 in The World’s 50 Best Bars 2019, with Monkey Shoulder whisky. Will you be giving it a try?

𝐈𝐧𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬
25ml Monkey Shoulder
25ml Calvados
10ml Mezcal
10ml oloroso sherry
50ml oat milk
5g zatar
15g demerara sugar 
Garnished with floregano •
Video by @50bestbars
#tw50bc #theworlds50bestcocktails
#Worlds50BestBars #50BestBars #Cocktail #Bar #London #Recipe #CocktailRecipe #Bartender #UK #whisky @monkeyshoulder @kwantlondon @eriklorincz

𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @manhattan_sg 

The Golden Hour is a sacred 60 minutes for wedding photographers – where the sun sets and beams warm golden light across the sky. It's also an hour that our fashion-fuelled Manhattanite, Vera Wang is very familiar with. The sun-soaked cream colour of a bridal gown is mirrored in our cocktail of Rockmelon Osmanthus, Belvedere Smogóry Forest Vodka, Lavender Bitters, and Bitter Orange and Elderflower Tonic. We think it’s that time of day, come try it! @belvederevodka @londonessenceco  

.

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @ebbydranks 

In honor of my unyielding love for all things figs and my new baby fig tree, I bestow upon you one of my favorite figgy cocktails. Maybe I'm also trying to send major Fall vibes to the universe with this #throwbackthursday post, too. Whatever tickles your proverbial pickle, make this drink and be merry. 

I have some of the weirdest dreams on the planet. I'm always being chased by a murderous monster when I'm running through some sort of thick jelly. Mmmmm thick jelly. Three Cs. Are my dreams my cocktail inspirations? Are cocktails my dreams come true? Do I just like to booze and blather on aimlessly? The last one. Here's a fantastic cocktail with some jammy goodness. 

The Golden Ladder 

2 oz bourbon (@garrisonbros)
1 oz lemon juice
0.5 oz honey syrup (@double.barrel.honey)
2 tsp fig preserves
1 egg white 

Combine all ingredients into a cocktail shaker without ice and dry shake for 1 minute. Add a large piece of ice and shake again for 20 seconds. Double strain into a chilled Nick and Nora glass (@amehla_co) and garnish with fresh figs. 

September is World Alzheimer's Month and there's no better time for @surfsidesips and I to work together and #endalz with your support by raising money for @alzassociation. The Alzheimer's Association leads the way to end Alzheimer's and all other dementia — by accelerating global research, driving risk reduction and early detection, and maximizing quality care and support. The Alzheimer's Association is also the largest non-profit committed to advancing vital research toward methods of treatment, prevention and, ultimately, a cure.

𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @alan_home_bartender_ 

•
🇬🇧 
Baby You're Driving :
•
Probably one of my favourite cocktail (I tend to say it to almost all equal parts cocktails it is so good!). Usually made with Bison Grass Vodka, I prefer it with a classic Grey Goose! One of the most refreshing and easy to reproduce cocktail I know!
•
- 25ml Vodka Grey Goose @greygoose 
- 25ml Grapefruit Liqueur 
- 25ml Lillet Blanc @lillet 
- 25ml Lime Juice
•
Method : Shaken
Garnish : Grapefruit and Mint
•
Glassware by : @nudeglass x @remy_savage_ 🍸
•
•
•
🇫🇷 
Baby You're Driving:
•
Probablement l'un de mes cocktails préférés (j'ai tendance à le dire à propos de tous les cocktails à parts égales mais c'est tellement bon!). Habituellement préparé avec de la Vodka "Bison Grass", je le préfère avec une Grey Goose classique! L'un des cocktails les plus rafraîchissants et faciles à reproduire que je connaisse!
•
- 25ml Vodka Grey Goose @greygoose 
- 25ml Liqueur de Pamplemousse
- 25ml Lillet Blanc @lillet 
- 25ml Jus de Citron Vert
•
Méthode : Au Shaker
Garnish : Zeste de Pamplemousse et Menthe
•
Verrerie par : @nudeglass x @remy_savage_ 
•

.
Shake with ice, pour, garnish and serve!

𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @chenaholic 

Hello friends! It’s been a while. I took a bit of a break from posting drinks, but hopefully some of you caught my Stories of my time in Seattle and all my recent food adventures! Now I’m back to create some more cocktails to share with you all, starting with a simple bourbon drink paired with passion fruit juice and nutty amaretto. Cheers!
-
Passion Nut
-
1.5 oz Bourbon
1 oz Passion Fruit Juice
.75 oz Fresh Lime Juice
.5 oz Amaretto
-
Add all ingredients into a shaker. Shake with ice, then strain into a rocks glass over a large ice cube. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @thecocktailsuite 

Träkál is a spirit that I’ve been anxious to try since coming across their page on IG. It’s a pear and apple based spirit that hails from the Chilean side of Patagonia. So I was excited to finally find a bottle. 

I first sampled Träkál neat, and I definitely agree with what I’ve read about the flavor profile. You want to say it tastes similar to something you’ve had before, but it’s hard to place. I found myself comparing it very closely to Smith and Cross Jamaican rum. I could definitely pull fruit out of the initial taste, but it’s also a little funky as well. And I could tell a small amount will go a long way in a cocktail. 

So my first instinct was to pair it with a rum. I tried a couple of rums in a couple of variations, but in the end I went the Banks 7 Golden Blend rum. 

𝗣𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗴𝗼𝗻𝗶𝗮𝗻 𝗣𝗶𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲 

1 𝘰𝘻 𝘉𝘢𝘯𝘬𝘴 7 𝘎𝘰𝘭𝘥𝘦𝘯 𝘉𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘥 𝘙𝘶𝘮
1/2 𝘰𝘻 𝘛𝘳ä𝘬á𝘭
1/2 𝘰𝘻 𝘈𝘭𝘱𝘪𝘯𝘦 𝘭𝘪𝘲𝘶𝘰𝘳
1/4 𝘰𝘻 𝘋𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘳𝘢𝘳𝘢 𝘴𝘺𝘳𝘶𝘱
2 𝘥𝘢𝘴𝘩𝘦𝘴 𝘉𝘪𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘴 𝘟𝘰𝘤𝘰𝘭𝘢𝘵𝘭 𝘔𝘰𝘭𝘦 𝘣𝘪𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘴
𝘎𝘢𝘳𝘯𝘪𝘴𝘩 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 3 𝘍𝘢𝘣𝘣𝘳𝘪 𝘤𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘴 

Method :: Add ingredients to a mixing glass and stir over ice until chilled. Strain into a double rocks/OF glass over a large piece of clear ice. Add 3 Fabbri cherries as a garnish. Cheers!
.
.
.
.

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @cheerstohappyhour 

(Recipe Included) - I posted a New York Sour recently that got a ton of love and I got curious what other drinks could use a Red Wine Float. If you love a NY Sour, here’s another concoction that should be on your list.
.
I used Supasawa instead of lemon Juice for a smooth finish and Orgeat to get a delightful nuttiness. The Orgeat I use might be a bit sweeter than yours so test the cocktail for acidity with a straw before adding the wine and just stir in another quarter oz if need be. I used a dry Spanish wine in this drink which worked soooo nicely!
.
I got the crabby cocktail pick from @joannabuchananofficial
.
Drink: Kingston Sour
2 oz Jamaican White Rum
0.75 oz Supasawa
0.5 oz Rich Orgeat
1 oz Red Wine
.
(Method)
Stir all ingredients less the Red Wine. Strain into a rocks or highball glass with ice. Layer on the Red Wine using a barspoon. Present and then combine the wine using barspoon. Garnish: Cherry

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @thecocktail.blog 

⚱️
The Cascara, or shell (pulp) that surrounds the Coffee Bean itself - usually discarded but being juicy and full of vitamins and caffeine it seems just natural to use this vital part of the coffee fruit
⚱️
And so did my good friends from @erlkoenigcascara also think - now enabling me to share the Love of Cascara with YOU
⚱️
Today you have a wonderful chance of winning the following;
🔮
2 bottles of Cascara Coffee Syrup
1 bag of Cascara
1 bag of Le Pedaleur Power Beans from World Champion Chocolatier Fabian Rimann
🔮
Got your Coffee Attention now?
It sure had mine
⚱️
I celebrated in the only way I know, with a most delightful Coffee Treatment;
⚱️
POWER OF CASCARA
⚱️
4.5 cl Rum Maestro Seleccion
1.5 cl Green Chartreuse
1 cl Cherry Coffee Syrup (@erlkoenigcascara )
2 Dashes Chocolate Bitters
Stir with much Love & Ice
Pour into glass over a large rock of Ice 🧊
Serve on a bed of Coffee Power Beans
Enjoy
Skål 🥂
⚱️
All you need to do is;
📯
1. Follow @erlkoenigcascara
2. Follow me if you want
3. Tell me who you would like to show off your new treats to - if you feel like it
📯

𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @sideshowpete_ 

Hey world-class bartenders, time to update your recipe book! Because we are adding ube to the mix. Ube, or sweet purple yam, is popular for making desserts all over the world! 🌏 But you can get it in powders and extract online. Ube's flavor can be described as vanilla meets pistachio, yum! Plus the pudding we use for the recipe has dairy for a creamy flavor. Mix up one of these and it will definitely be one that is talked about well after happy hour! ⠀
.⠀
If using powdered ube, follow instructions on the back to a pudding-like consistency. Then add ube pudding, vodka, simple and shake with ice. If you are using fresh ube yams, then you will need to make ube pudding for the mix, from scratch. Don't worry the recipe is easy to find online. 👍😅 ⠀
.⠀
💜🍸🍠Ube Martini🍠🍸💜⠀
2 oz Vodka⠀
2 oz Ube Pudding
0.5 oz Simple Syrup⠀
garnish with small toasted marshmallows  
- - - - -
